title: Dieudonné module
summary: In mathematics, a Dieudonné module introduced by Jean Dieudonné (1954, 1957b),  is a module over the non-commutative Dieudonné ring, which is generated over the ring of Witt vectors by two special  endomorphisms F {\displaystyle F} and V {\displaystyle V} called the Frobenius and Verschiebung operators. They are used for studying finite flat commutative group schemes.
